Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of new IRS agents that will be hired to enforce the Affordable Care Act.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support for the assertion that 16,000 new IRS agents will be prying into private medical records.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the purpose of hiring new IRS agents is to invade individuals' privacy and violate their medical records.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the hiring of new IRS agents, such as ensuring compliance with tax-related provisions of the Affordable Care Act.
